subject: Writing
title: Amanda Gorman at the Inauguration
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Amanda Gorman at the Inauguration.

hook.text: At 22, Amanda Gorman stood before 33 million viewers and read a poem that silenced a divided nation.

buildup.text: She was the youngest inaugural poet in US history, reading 'The Hill We Climb' at Biden's 2021 inauguration.

discovery.text: Her poem acknowledged pain and division while calling for unity â€” a tightrope walk in verse.

twist.text: Gorman has a speech impediment. She used poetry as therapy and turned her challenge into her superpower.

climax.text: The poem became a bestselling book. She became a global symbol of poetry's power in political life.

punchline.text: A poet with a stutter spoke for an entire nation.

quiz.question: What was Amanda Gorman's inaugural poem called?
